column1: Congratulations to President Elect @JoeBiden and Vice President Elect @KamalaHarris! I look forward to working with your administration to tackle the COVID-19 pandemic build our economic recovery and unite our communities & country. https://t.co/hrZhIOiPLY

Virginians voted early in record-breaking numbers because they know what’s on the ballot: healthcare is on the ballot our COVID-19 response is on the ballot & our economic recovery is on the ballot.  More on the last day of early voting and Halloween festivities from @NBC12: https://t.co/XXCYCCuYhh

From fighting to lower the cost of prescription drugs to negotiating and passing the USMCA to working for Covid-19 relief for the 7th District I will always take on the hard fights to do what is right for Central Virginia. https://t.co/G6qxxXNpRr

Sen. Paul made these comments when he was in VA supporting my opponent.   Our #VA07 restaurants need commonsense relief not hair-brained schemes and an outright denial of science. That's why I'm continuing to fight for small business assistance in the next COVID-19 package. https://t.co/DVsUQb5kSB

As COVID-19 hurts the rural economy we must protect our crop & livestock producers from the damaging effects of a historically uncertain economy.  We can’t turn our backs on the hard-working men & women who feed our country and the world. https://t.co/AZlCBcL2BK

Combatting the health effects of the COVID-19 crisis takes wide-ranging and intentional effort.   I've fought to increase PPE for our healthcare workers protect our seniors and build a national testing strategy. #VA07    https://t.co/ke6Y9Bx9vi

Amid the COVID-19 crisis I’ve pushed for more PPP funding increased access to PPE for employees & strengthened support to help businesses recover.   But our work is not done. That's why I'm fighting for both parties to pass another COVID-19 relief package.   #VA07
During this ongoing pandemic I’m focused on COVID-19 relief including relief to small business owners - that’s why I’ve been endorsed by the U.S. Chamber of Commerce. #VA07

Tomorrow Central Virginians will learn more about our distinct views on healthcare education the economy the fight against COVID-19 & more during our #VA07 debate.   Thank you to @ChamberRVA & @myVPM for hosting and @costareports for moderating. #VA07 https://t.co/42m40xArEa

We must invest in our economic recovery. I joined @BillFitzCBS6 to discuss what I’ve been hearing from small business owners and why passing the next COVID-19 relief package is so crucial. https://t.co/mW0GX5alVf

Join #TeamSpanberger volunteers this weekend to help us with our socially-distant contactless lit drop program.  Sign up to help us safely spread the word about voting for Abigail with our friends and neighbors in #VA07:  https://t.co/UPcmDA4OnU https://t.co/edSJBsiWr8

Last week I participated in a telephone town hall with @AARPVa members. We discussed the need to protect Social Security strengthen Medicare and address COVID-19's impact on our economy. Listen here: https://t.co/TiyOZuBddr

Thank you @8News for the opportunity to speak about the need to move forward on COVID-19 relief protect healthcare coverage for #VA07 families and keep working across the aisle. Watch here: https://t.co/Xn9s5OgR5J

“I intend to go back to Congress in January of 2021 ensuring that we are rebuilding our country in a thoughtful way — that we are investing in our communities and our infrastructure as a pathway out of the economic crisis that has been COVID-19.” #Economy #VA07

“In the COVID-19 pandemic we have seen how disconnected communities and families are impacted by their inability to connect to schools or jobs.”   “This is an investment in our future.”   (For more👇)   https://t.co/uIRuWLrtem  #DigitalDivide #VA07

“We currently have an administration that is fighting in the courts to undo the ACA. The ACA is the law of the land that gives protections to people with pre-existing conditions & now we have millions of Americans who may have pre-existing conditions due to COVID-19.” #ACA #VA07

“One of the hardest aspects of the COVID-19 pandemic is the impact on our nation’s children & the impact on our nation’s families...   “As a Member of Congress I am supportive of federal efforts to support schools through CARES Act funding.” #education #VA07

For 2 years I’ve worked to be a strong voice in Congress on the issues that impact people’s daily lives in #VA07.  -Lowering the cost of prescription drugs -Expanding broadband internet access -Recovering from the COVID-19 pandemic  Support our campaign:  https://t.co/tYqIjmWIb2

More than 200000 Americans have died many of them alone.   Unable to be comforted by their families.   Their loved ones never got to say goodbye.   Because of the contagious nature of COVID-19.   And then there is this 👇 https://t.co/5VrD0Efg8g
Amid the COVID-19 crisis we need to support and protect small businesses — the backbone of our economy.   For more:   https://t.co/M09rsHGkR5   #NationalSmallBusinessWeek https://t.co/1leBJ7ccdQ

Thank you to everyone who joined us at our socially-distant day of action! This is a people-powered campaign and it was wonderful to see so many people ready to volunteer their time to #TeamSpanberger! Only 38 days left let’s do this! https://t.co/w3Q4gROmR5

Last night in between votes I attended a virtual back-to-school night at my daughter’s school.   I continue to be thankful for our educators who have not only adapted to the COVID19 teaching environment but who have modeled resiliency generosity and optimism in doing so.

I joined @NBC29 to talk about the urgent need for a new COVID-19 relief bill and how I’m working with a bipartisan group of colleagues to bring one forward to provide support to Americans our small businesses our schools and the testing efforts necessary to reopen fully. https://t.co/BNmh0LDvoH

The American people and small businesses need more COVID19 relief.  That’s why I worked to develop a bipartisan relief package framework. We announced it this week w/the support of 25 Dems & 25 Reps and support for our proposal keeps growing. https://t.co/uXjnudCVs5
I joined @Jaaavis and @MarquesDJones to discuss my work in Congress COVID-19 and our campaign here in #VA07. Find the full episode on Apple and Spotify or listen here: https://t.co/BzOwdEgS2B

Black women are 3 times more likely to die in childbirth than white women in Virginia. This disparity is egregious & unacceptable. I'm proud of my work to focus federal efforts on addressing healthcare inequalities which are more clear during COVID-19. https://t.co/FTtIrUSNCI

When COVID-19 began spreading to our communities we saw the dedication of our frontline medical workers. I recognized their commitment as the same traits that drove my mom in her work as a nurse. I’ll always fight for what’s best for #VA07 patients providers & their families. https://t.co/kxwe57jctn

For many the pandemic is taking a toll on mental health causing feelings of grief fear worry & isolation. A new Virginia crisis line just received additional funding to respond to the behavioral health impacts of COVID-19. Read more here: https://t.co/1u8RLwDxg3

Despite the increase in COVID-19 cases in Central Virginia fewer people are getting tested. We must change that and increase testing! Here's a story featuring my experience getting tested & why testing is such a crucial tool in the fight against COVID-19: https://t.co/1bA9GSd6XG

Thank you to the @USChamber for your endorsement! I have been focused on creating opportunity here in #VA07 by supporting local businesses which are not only the backbone of our economy but will drive our economic & unemployment recovery from the ongoing COVID-19 crisis. https://t.co/4TkHAbSnZq

New voter registration in Virginia has dropped significantly during the COVID-19 pandemic. But our country and Commonwealth need every eligible voter in Virginia to be registered and ready to vote.   Visit: https://t.co/r1vygnRDMH to register.  https://t.co/9NEzIXFCXf
The administration’s trying to block funding from our next COVID19 relief bill that would help states conduct testing and contact tracing. (1/4) https://t.co/Bq41fe6ztM

During this coronavirus pandemic access to computers at home is more important than ever. I introduced the Computers for Veterans and Students Act which would provide refurbished government computers to veterans students and seniors. https://t.co/31DceNMdrP

Supporting assisted-living and long-term care facilities during this COVID crisis is not a partisan issue. We must all come together to make sure our loved ones and those who care for them are getting the protection and support they need. https://t.co/Kxf7BrmbmN

I am concerned COVID-19 relief funding “so far has neglected to provide much-needed funding to free clinics charitable clinics and other providers that serve uninsured patients” as I wrote in a June 19 letter to Health and Human Services Secretary Azar. https://t.co/Wmj7pmQ5lM

Virginia’s Medicaid enrollment has increased during the COVID-19 outbreak — and we’ve seen firsthand why protecting Medicaid is so vital. Virginia families need the security of knowing they can get medical care if they need it during this pandemic. https://t.co/FIO383k6qq

During a pandemic this is what the administration chooses to do. This is a reckless assault on our healthcare system as we see spikes in COVID-19 cases around the country and Americans continue to die. 5/6

Testing for the coronavirus is key to our ability to reopen our schools our businesses and communities safely.  Across the country we are still not testing at the rates we should be and ending federal support to testing efforts is a huge mistake. https://t.co/lxZmXHXa9X

Because of COVID-19 many neighbors are coming together to support each other in inspiring ways. Donna Brumfield a 96-year-old Chesterfield resident has sewed more than 600 masks to give away. Read more: https://t.co/HPgKCtIKEc

Paul Kochar was unable to return home from a visit to India due to the COVID-19 pandemic but he needed to return quickly to care for his elderly parents. I’m grateful that Paul is now safely home in Midlothian & that my team was able to provide assistance. Watch from @NBC12: https://t.co/QGkFIxLLxj
And if you would like a physical sign to be delivered to your home in the 7th district by our trained socially-distant volunteer team please visit: https://t.co/N5tYUAr5TX
Behind this feel-good story of a community effort to boost spirits during COVID-19 is another story — a hopeful decades-long story between two Culpeper and Orange residents. https://t.co/8v91gcvid8

The events of the past weeks as well as the COVID-19 pandemic have laid bare the inequalities in our justice education & healthcare systems. @DrWinnUIC of @VCUMassey Dr. Janice Underwood of @dei_virginia & I address this crisis for @RTDOpinions. https://t.co/l4vbJnbRdq

In pulling the United States out of the WHO (the organization coordinating global COVID-19 vaccine & drug trials & critical public health efforts) we are abdicating our role of global leadership. (1/2)   https://t.co/I5vENTlJh1

Read their stories: - a candy striper - a pistol-packing preacher - a basketball coach - a family jokester - someone who loved trivia - someone who was shot in the line duty - someone w/a million dollar smile - someone who save 56 families from the Gestapo  All lost to COVID-19 https://t.co/EhL1lWmfWM

Today @RedCross meets need in new ways such as launching a Virtual Family Assistance Center to support those struggling with loss & grief.  Their teams work on the front lines responding to the impacts of COVID-19. Follow @VARedCross for ways you can help here in Virginia.

The COVID-19 pandemic impacts all of us and I’m here to serve all of the people of #VA07.  This focus means pushing for real bipartisan solutions as I’ve done with my calls for expanded high-speed internet infrastructure. https://t.co/uVHoDqTQAh

This morning I was in Culpeper volunteering at the Empowering Culpeper (@peopleincofva ) food distribution event. After I visited a COVID-19 drive-through testing site run with @uvahealthnews & @VDHgov. I'm grateful to each volunteer & healthcare worker serving our neighbors. https://t.co/uOjnvqwHLm

This Louisa citizen clearly understands the importance of getting COVID19-related relief for smaller and rural communities (one of my top priorities).  To my rural constituents: I will always be here to listen understand complex issues and fight for you. https://t.co/0N6OcPFmOS

COVID-19 has worsened our country’s digital divide. Americans in rural areas like those in #VA07 need reliable internet access. That’s why I’m leading a bipartisan effort to expand broadband access from coast to coast. Thanks for the convo @1a & @NPR. https://t.co/YAASa87JrQ

Two of my top priorities for #VA07 in upcoming COVID-19 response packages:  -COVID19-related relief for smaller and rural communities -Strengthened broadband infrastructure investment  https://t.co/9iB8N9Qf5o https://t.co/eld1hHwXlU

Here’s CDC’s modeling of Covid-19 deaths. Considering these models the scientific agreement that the virus will resurge & reports that mutations may be more contagious & the virus may impact children in new ways why would we disband a task force ostensibly created to fight it? https://t.co/1maq4ybfrH https://t.co/1tY2dWf0Vc

Strengthened funding for states and localities in the next coronavirus legislation is crucial. The services they provide are too important to be underfunded or overlooked.  Thank you @washingtonpost for highlighting the urgent need for this investment. https://t.co/k4bQvvlnCP

I joined @RepEBJ @AngieCraigMN @Deb4CongressNM @HoulahanForPa and  @jennymkaplan on  the “Women Belong in the House” podcast to discuss what it’s like to lead in unprecedented times and to serve our communities through the COVID-19 crisis: https://t.co/OqfpU1blOM

The COVID-19 pandemic is exacerbating the digital divide for students families & businesses and it’s why I led a bipartisan 75-plus Member call for a historic investment in broadband infrastructure.  https://t.co/Sfckt3L3gv

My thoughts are with the family of Dr. Lorna Breen in Charlottesville. Dr. Breen is a hero who worked on the heartbreaking front lines of her emergency room. This tragedy shows the severe emotional & mental toll of COVID-19 on frontline healthcare workers. https://t.co/3QXwEAPD0Z

The latest COVID-19 response package will bring much-needed aid to small businesses in #VA07.   Next up: we need to push for assistance to states & localities. From maintaining utilities to maintaining law enforcement & EMS services they need our support. https://t.co/eatK6as4TP

We are facing heartbreaking loss at our local nursing homes & long-term care facilities. I hold the loved ones of those who have died in my heart and I’m helping care providers fight COVID19 by advocating for their needs - relief funding PPE and tests.  https://t.co/Da3lGgz4WW

Joined @Morning_Joe with @ElaineLuriaVA  to discuss the COVID-19 pandemic in VA. I’m glad I got a chance to speak specifically on how important the Paycheck Protection Program is to the the small business owners in #VA07. #FundPPP https://t.co/ACAvUNus9c

NatSec professionals raised alarms in 2019 Congress received briefings in early 2020 & the @HouseForeign Asia Subcommittee held its 1st #Coronavirus hearing on Feb. 5th. We can’t permit the White House to rewrite history on the timeline of our nation’s knowledge of #COVID-19. https://t.co/VEcM7QxyKt

We are in a pandemic. Now is not the time to cut funding to the World Health Organization.   Now is the time to do everything we can to combat the coronavirus and improve public health including working with international organizations and partners around the world. https://t.co/uhJgXPp77J

Today the death toll at Canterbury reached 45 — the worst COVID-19-related loss of life of any nursing home in the United States.  Behind each loss is a parent grandparent uncle aunt or close friend. These are heartbreaking times for our community.   https://t.co/2rTbXLedew

The majority of lives lost to COVID-19 in Virginia have been infected in our nursing and long-term care facilities.  The tragedy at Canterbury in #VA07 shows just how devastating this disease can be for older at-risk populations.  They need our support.   https://t.co/U6P8ZbeTy4

Coordinating Virginia’s response to the COVID-19 threat to nursing homes and long-term care facilities is necessary to avoiding more tragedies. I’ve spoken to ⁦@GovernorVA⁩ about this effort and I’m appreciative of this life-saving initiative. https://t.co/IGrAE3xhlf

Only 53% of U.S. students in small towns or rural areas have access to high-speed internet compared to 77% of suburban students.   I'm urging Senate and House leadership to include WiFi hotspot funding in the next #Coronavirus relief package. 2/2

Throughout my first term in Congress I have been advocating for expanded access to high-speed broadband internet. During the #Coronavirus pandemic we have seen just how critical it is that we strengthen our nation's internet infrastructure. 1/2 https://t.co/JWjlOGm0NM

Pearl Harbor was a surprise military attack that we didn’t know was coming & couldn’t prepare for.   COVID19 is a virus that we saw spread across the world as our intel agencies & scientists warned us.   This is an inaccurate & shameful comparison. https://t.co/8uBGTUztPl
This is the beauty of #VA07. Thank you to the @LouisaCoSheriff for such an initiative to keep our community and seniors safe during the #COVID19 pandemic. #FlattenTheCurve https://t.co/OmZIpeOHK1

Sen. Graham’s now holding up the #Covid19 relief package.   He thinks the unemployment ins. provisions are so good that nurses will quit to collect unemployment.   That’s not how nurses work.   That’s not how unemployment ins. works.   As he said yesterday #PassTheDamnBill 2/2 https://t.co/cecrojiTxp

I’ve been asked why the US House hasn’t yet voted on the #Covid19 relief package agreed upon late last night - the one Sen. Graham called “damn good” on the Senate Floor.   It’s because the Senate hasn’t yet voted on it & hasn’t yet sent it over to the House.   Why is that?  1/2 https://t.co/UP43BtKXpX

Our front line workers need masks respirators gowns shields & ventilators now.  So I worked w/colleagues of both parties to introduce a resolution calling on the Administration to use the Defense Production Act to direct the production of supplies needed to fight #COVIDー19. https://t.co/fbAkXUP6O6

Thank you to Sean Gorman and @jmattingly306 at @RTDNEWS for highlighting the food security challenges in our region during the  #COVID19 crisis.   Our food pantries are stepping up in the middle of an unprecedented emergency. But they need our help.   https://t.co/JUfk3aoP7W

📢🗣ATTENTION #VA07 small business owners:   In response to the #CoronavirusPandemic @SBAgov has now opened the application for disaster assistance loans.   To apply or learn more click here:  https://t.co/KKrXfOWmst  https://t.co/0yU794UnKe

The warnings from U.S. intel agencies increased in volume toward the end of Jan & into early Feb. . . By then a majority of the intelligence reporting included in daily briefing papers and digests from the Office of the DNI & CIA was about #COVID19. . . https://t.co/31EcuUgRFq
There is a shortage of swabs to conduct the #COVID19 tests compounding the challenge of insufficient tests.   The worst case scenario is now. 3/  https://t.co/E5wNwOhv0E
States are rationing #COVID19 tests.   The worst case scenario is now.  2/ https://t.co/PJTu9LEA0p.    https://t.co/0DqA7IVsZq  https://t.co/BNaCp96UWI.
The CDC is giving suggestions for how hospitals can utilize homemade masks on its website.    The worst case scenario is now. #COVID19   https://t.co/pOgpKwiPyH https://t.co/3RuvZ4tOeK
For #Spotsylvania residents:   For updates on the response to COVID-19 please visit the @SpotsyGov website at https://t.co/5tr7UT5hHr  or follow their Facebook page at https://t.co/5HdCsCVchs.
And for #Powhatan parents:   For general information from Powhatan County Public Schools regarding COVID-19 and meal distribution please visit their website at https://t.co/GkvL9QC99H

For our #Powhatan neighbors:   For more information regarding COVID-19 in @PowhatanCounty visit this website: https://t.co/bX2kmsrEZT   And for local updates and news surrounding COVID-19 follow the Powhatan County Emergency Management Twitter: https://t.co/vfAh0EMkXU

For #Orange parents:   For general info and updates relating to COVID-19 and Orange County Public Schools please visit this website: https://t.co/QtUDlysDhd   For more information on meal distribution go here: https://t.co/m116faqrEX
For #Orange residents:   For general updates relating to COVID-19 and the response in Orange County visit their website at https://t.co/xSAg2ocPPw

For #Louisa parents:   For updates regarding COVID-19 and @LCPSchools please visit their Planning & Information page: https://t.co/uHauDnKu1f   And for more information on community meal distribution visit the LCPS website: https://t.co/1nqy04QS3s
For #Louisa residents:  For general info and updates on COVID-19 in @LouisaCountyVA please visit https://t.co/aIyoOi1XQN   You can also visit their FB page at https://t.co/hXKNA40FOI

For #Henrico parents: For more info on meal pickup times and locations visit https://t.co/wlu17jXwLl   And for general COVID-19 information regarding closings food distribution and more visit the @HenricoSchools Facebook page at https://t.co/5hfl77Bcah

For #Henrico @HenricoNews has created an online resource to share the latest news and information during the pandemic. This dashboard can be found at https://t.co/XrljPWqw1Q.   The County has also set up a COVID-19 information hotline at 804-501-5655 from 7:00 AM - 7:00PM M-F.

For #Goochland parents:   For general updates relating to COVID-19 and @glndschools visit their website at https://t.co/UuQUF2tvuq  And to learn more about meal distribution to students during closures visit https://t.co/dQgldyjw9V
For our neighbors in #Goochland:   For general updates relating to COVID-19 follow the @GoochlandGovtVA Facebook page at https://t.co/aWSvlHOUBA
For our #Culpeper residents:   For general news and updates about the local response to COVID-19 please visit the Culpeper County website at https://t.co/vCMyzVCFAB
First for general information and frequent updates on how @VDEM and @VDHgov are responding to COVID-19 across the Commonwealth please visit: https://t.co/7pVWfFpJQo

In an effort to provide resources to #VA07 residents with up-to-date information relevant to their areas during the #CoronavirusPandemic I've provided this thread with useful links for each county and public school district 👇

As we face significant uncertainty due to the #coronavirus pandemic I want to take a moment to thank the hospital staff first responders grocery store employees community pharmacists lab technicians and everyone else on the front lines of this crisis. You are true heroes. https://t.co/dsKSmnMMBD

My teams are working remotely and we have asked our wonderful volunteers to stay home and safe. Please do your best to stay away from large crowds practice #SocialDistancing and check in with your friends and family by calling or video chatting. #COVID19 https://t.co/x9t9NbEIz7

These simulations show how #COVIDー19 spreads and why we must employ social distancing in order to keep our friends families and neighbors safe by attempting to flatten the curve.  https://t.co/iJygo5c2RJ

Social distancing and avoiding larger groups of people are vitally important ways to contain the spread of #COVIDー19 because those with milder symptoms may not know they are sick but can still spread it. https://t.co/rvZJujXkp4

Making COVID19 tests available should be a bipartisan issue  Protecting healthcare workers should be a bipartisan issue  Ensuring people can take sick days to stop the spread should be a bipartisan issue  Helping kids who rely on school food programs should be a bipartisan issue
For more information about how to keep you and your family safe during the #CoronavirusOutbreak please go to the @CDCgov webpage:   https://t.co/ASSNc1Rndb

Our coordinated response to coronavirus must rely on evidence and experts.  I’ll keep working in Congress to make sure our #VA07 communities and local healthcare facilities are prepared.   https://t.co/soRBuaaalt
